key_title: Key to the species of Persicaria

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Polygonaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Polygonaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Polygonaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Inflorescence of dense, or sometimes interrupted, ovoid to cylindric spikes; leaves attenuate at base; stems without reflexed hairs
Inflorescence 2 (rarely 3)-branched, flowers rather distant; leaves hastate at base; stems with stiff reflexed hairs
Leaves glabrous or with scattered bristles, never densely pubescent
Undersurfaces of leaves densely pubescent, often appearing whitish
Stems and peduncles densely to sparsely hairy
Stems and peduncles glabrous (rarely with a very few scattered hairs)
Ochreas developed from upper margin into a spreading green limb; plants not rhizomatous
Ochreas not developing green limb; plants rhizomatous
Leaves to 5 cm long and 1 cm wide; margin of ochreas lobed or toothed and ciliate
Leaves more than 6 cm long and 3 cm wide; margin of ochreas entire, ciliate
Glands absent from at least flowers and ochreas; leaves not peppery tasting
Virtually all parts of plant with conspicuous glands; leaves with very hot, peppery taste
Ochreas with marginal bristles; leaves eglandular or sparsely glandular on lower surface; flowers bright pink; leaves often with a dark blotch toward base
Ochreas without marginal bristles; leaves with more or less yellowish glands on at least lower surface; flowers dull pink or whitish
Spikes usually slender (3–5 mm diam.), narrowly cylindric, rather lax; leaves glabrous except along margins and main veins; perennial
Spikes stout (7–10 mm diam.), more or less ovoid, dense; pedicels exceeding subtending bracts; leaves commonly with short appressed hairs on lamina; annual
Flowers white or greenish; leaves without strong coriander-like smell
Flowers pink or white; leaves with a strong coriander-like smell; plants cultivated
Leaf undersurface cobwebbed, hairs shedding with age; veins with short scales c. 0.4 mm long
Leaf undersurface subvillous; veins with long appressed hairs c. 2 mm long
